name: Version 1.34.0
body:
* Handle host path directory creation failure differently for podman 
* Don't use shared bind mounts

name: Version 1.33.0
body:
Fix ulimit issue with docker
Output generated by the container runtime during `_prepare_build_container` stage is directed to stderr

name: Fixed type error during shell interpolation
Add support for shell commands interpolation
Added publish ports support
body:
Added publish ports support 
Set default network to bridge when running on mac

name: support multiple config files
body: This should allow users to export their own config that will override the default skipper.yaml

name: Allow running skipper as root
body: In case skipper username is root set the HOME_DIR env to /root instead of /home/{username}

name: Fixes for MAC and SELinux
body:
docker group may not exists
SELinux forbit relabeling content in /usr

name: Remote docker images enhancements
body:
Allow PBR versioning scheme when pushing to registry (So we can have 1.2.3. or 4.5.6.patch. as a version
Support authenticated Registry
Add the hash as tag argument so use can build an image which is based on another image on the same build (So we can have base image and multiple derived images with the same tag)
Better support for Mac (Not finalized yet - some issue the docker user which does not exists on mac - maybe fixed by what you did for podman - need to check)

name: Enhance podman support
body:
Allow running skipper with podman without root user
Disabled network command while running with podman
Revoming set user in entrypoint while running with podman
Adding special treatment for docker/config and .gitconfig files
Added skipper install test matrix

name: Allow to install skipper without root permissions
body:
Handle bash-completion differently to support non-root installations.
Adding support for podman.
*If docker and podman are installed , docker will be used as default

name: Create mounted volumes before running docker
body:
If we mount to a directory the doesn't exist, docker will create the local directory.

If we let docker create the directories, it will create it owned by root-user, and then the container won't be able to write to the directory.
By creating them in-advance, we make them owned by the user, and the container can write to them.
BTW - This solves the problem with 'go build' not being able to write to the 'gocache' directory.

name: skipper.yaml: Allow type list for environment variables
Allow creating container from non git repositories
